main event: A circular object approximately 35-40 ft in diameter was sighted over Charles Town, W. Va. on February 25, 1952.
interesting points: The object was silver in color and moved rapidly in a straight line at an estimated speed of 500 mph,The object appeared to get smaller as it moved away at an angle of 35-40 degrees from the horizon,The sighting lasted for about 45 seconds until it disappeared from view,The object emitted no sound during the observation,The witness reported the sighting to the Air Force and police, but no further investigation was made.
